subject: It's always a people problem

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 8/12/06, Simon Chappell <simonpeterchappell@... 
> <mailto:simonpeterchappell%40gmail.com>> wrote:

>  > Good quality comes from good design. (and caring and testing). So
>  > again, you actually enforce my point.
> 
> No, because TDD doesn't necessarily equate good design. You don't magically
> come up with a good design when you do TDD.
> 
> It's really about the developer. If she's good, she'll produce good tests
> and high quality software regardless of whether she uses TDD or not.

Isn't it always about the programmer?

OK, now that we're past that concept, TDD is a fantastic way to instill 
greatness in a programmer. It's not the only way; it might not be the 
best way; but it's a very effective way--much more effective than 
anything else I've seen in the past.
--
